rounded-[18px] px-4 py-1.5 data-[multiline]:py-3" data-multiline=""><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">FACE RECOGNITION PROJECT
		Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV
Overview
This project implements a real-time face recognition system using Python and OpenCV. It uses Haar Cascade Classifier for face detection and LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer for training and recognition. The system can detect faces from webcam input, collect datasets, train a model, and perform recognition in real-time.
Features
ïƒ˜	Capture dataset of face images using webcam  
ïƒ˜	Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset  
ïƒ˜	Real-time face recognition via webcam  
ïƒ˜	Modular, simple, and beginner-friendly  
Algorithms &amp; Technologies Used
&gt;	Haar Cascade Classifier ïƒ  For detecting faces in frames  
&gt;	LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) ïƒ  For recognizing and matching faces  
&gt;	Python Libraries:
o	OpenCV
o	NumPy
o	Pillow 
Workflow
1.	Create Dataset â€“ Capture 30 samples of the userâ€™s face via webcam  
2.	Train Model â€“ Train LBPH recognizer using the collected dataset  
3.	 Recognize Faces â€“ Detect and recognize faces in real-time   
Project Structure
FaceRecognitionProject/
ïƒ«	dataset/                                # Collected face images
ïƒ«	0_create_dataset.py          # Script to collect face dataset using webcam
ïƒ«	1_train_model.py               # Script to train the recognizer and save trainer.yml

Installation
1.	Clone this repository:
git clone https://github.com/YourUsername/FaceRecognitionProject.git
cd FaceRecognitionProject
2.	Install required dependencies:
pip install -r requirements.txt

 Usage
1.	Collect Dataset
         python 0_create_dataset.py
ï‚§	Enter a numeric user ID and name
ï‚§	Look at the camera until 30 samples are captured
2.	Train Model
        python 1_train_model.py
â€¢	Trains LBPH model and generates trainer.yml
3.	Run Real-Time Recognition
         python 2_face_recognition.py
â€¢	Detects and recognizes known faces from webcam input
 Sample Output
â€¢	Faces detected are highlighted with rectangles
â€¢	Recognized faces show User ID / Name and confidence score

<hr data-start="170" data-end="173">
<h1 data-start="175" data-end="203">Face Recognition Project</h1>
<p data-start="204" data-end="261"><strong data-start="204" data-end="259">Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV</strong></p>
<h2 data-start="263" data-end="276">Overview</h2>
<p data-start="277" data-end="533">This project implements a <strong data-start="303" data-end="340">real-time face recognition system</strong> using Python and OpenCV. It leverages the <strong data-start="383" data-end="410">Haar Cascade Classifier</strong> for face detection and <strong data-start="434" data-end="493">LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer</strong> for face recognition. The system can:</p>
<ul data-start="535" data-end="676">
<li data-start="535" data-end="569">
<p data-start="537" data-end="569">Detect faces from webcam input</p>
</li>
<li data-start="570" data-end="604">
<p data-start="572" data-end="604">Collect datasets for new users</p>
</li>
<li data-start="605" data-end="643">
<p data-start="607" data-end="643">Train a model for face recognition</p>
</li>
<li data-start="644" data-end="676">
<p data-start="646" data-end="676">Recognize faces in real-time</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="678" data-end="734">It is <strong data-start="684" data-end="731">modular, beginner-friendly, and easy to use</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="736" data-end="739">
<h2 data-start="741" data-end="754">Features</h2>
<ul data-start="755" data-end="951">
<li data-start="755" data-end="804">
<p data-start="757" data-end="804">Capture dataset of face images using a webcam</p>
</li>
<li data-start="805" data-end="853">
<p data-start="807" data-end="853">Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset</p>
</li>
<li data-start="854" data-end="895">
<p data-start="856" data-end="895">Real-time face recognition via webcam</p>
</li>
<li data-start="896" data-end="951">
<p data-start="898" data-end="951">Simple and modular structure for easy understanding</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h2 data-start="1251" data-end="1264">Workflow</h2>

</li>
<li data-start="531" data-end="596">
<p data-start="534" data-end="596">Give a <strong data-start="541" data-end="560">repository name</strong> (e.g., <code data-start="568" data-end="592">FaceRecognitionProject</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="597" data-end="634">
<p data-start="600" data-end="634">Add an optional <strong data-start="616" data-end="631">description</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="635" data-end="673">
<p data-start="638" data-end="673">Select <strong data-start="645" data-end="655">Public</strong> or <strong data-start="659" data-end="670">Private</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="674" data-end="739">
<p data-start="677" data-end="739">Do <strong data-start="680" data-end="687">not</strong> initialize with README, license, or <code data-start="724" data-end="736">.gitignore</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="740" data-end="773">
<p data-start="743" data-end="773">Click <strong data-start="749" data-end="770">Create repository</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="775" data-end="778">
<h2 data-start="780" data-end="817"><strong data-start="783" data-end="815">Step 3: Upload Files via Web</strong></h2>
<ol data-start="818" data-end="1100">
<li data-start="818" data-end="877">
<p data-start="821" data-end="877">On your new repository page, click <strong data-start="856" data-end="874">â€œUpload filesâ€</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="878" data-end="971">
<p data-start="881" data-end="971">Drag and drop your <strong data-start="900" data-end="926">unzipped project files</strong> (or <code data-start="931" data-end="937">.zip</code> contents) into the upload area.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="972" data-end="1069">
<p data-start="975" data-end="1069">Scroll down and write a <strong data-start="999" data-end="1017">commit message</strong> like <code data-start="1023" data-end="1066">Initial commit - Face Recognition Project</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1070" data-end="1100">
<p data-start="1073" data-end="1100">Click <strong data-start="1079" data-end="1097">Commit changes</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<blockquote data-start="1102" data-end="1197">
<p data-start="1104" data-end="1197"><strong data-start="1104" data-end="1113">Note:</strong> You cannot upload the zipped folder directlyâ€”you need to upload its <strong data-start="1182" data-end="1194">contents</strong>.</p>
</blockquote>
<hr data-start="1199" data-end="1202">
<h2 data-start="1204" data-end="1234"><strong data-start="1207" data-end="1232">Step 4: Verify Upload</strong></h2>
<ul data-start="1235" data-end="1378">
<li data-start="1235" data-end="1267">
<p data-start="1237" data-end="1267">Refresh the repository page.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1268" data-end="1378">
<p data-start="1270" data-end="1378">You should see all your files including <code data-start="1310" data-end="1321">README.md</code>, scripts, dataset folder (if small), and requirements.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1380" data-end="1383">
<h3 data-start="1385" data-end="1409"><strong data-start="1389" data-end="1407">Optional Tips:</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1410" data-end="1608">
<li data-start="1410" data-end="1547">
<p data-start="1412" data-end="1547">If your dataset is too large, <strong data-start="1442" data-end="1471">do not upload it directly</strong>â€”use <code data-start="1476" data-end="1488">.gitignore</code> for the dataset folder and keep only scripts and README.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1548" data-end="1608">
<p data-start="1550" data-end="1608">You can add the dataset later via <strong data-start="1584" data-end="1595">Git LFS</strong> if needed.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1610" data-end="1613">
<p data-start="1615" data-end="1761">If you want, I can give you a <strong data-start="1645" data-end="1719">ready step-by-step plan for uploading your project without the dataset</strong>, which is the best practice for GitHub.</p>

<hr data-start="170" data-end="173">
<h1 data-start="175" data-end="203">Face Recognition Project</h1>
<p data-start="204" data-end="261"><strong data-start="204" data-end="259">Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV</strong></p>
<h2 data-start="263" data-end="276">Overview</h2>
<p data-start="277" data-end="508">This project implements a <strong data-start="303" data-end="340">real-time face recognition system</strong> using Python and OpenCV. It uses <strong data-start="374" data-end="401">Haar Cascade Classifier</strong> for face detection and <strong data-start="425" data-end="484">LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer</strong> for face recognition.</p>
<p data-start="510" data-end="527">The system can:</p>
<ul data-start="528" data-end="669">
<li data-start="528" data-end="562">
<p data-start="530" data-end="562">Detect faces from webcam input</p>
</li>
<li data-start="563" data-end="597">
<p data-start="565" data-end="597">Collect datasets for new users</p>
</li>
<li data-start="598" data-end="636">
<p data-start="600" data-end="636">Train a model for face recognition</p>
</li>
<li data-start="637" data-end="669">
<p data-start="639" data-end="669">Recognize faces in real-time</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="671" data-end="674">
<h2 data-start="676" data-end="689">Features</h2>
<ul data-start="690" data-end="873">
<li data-start="690" data-end="739">
<p data-start="692" data-end="739">Capture dataset of face images using a webcam</p>
</li>
<li data-start="740" data-end="788">
<p data-start="742" data-end="788">Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset</p>
</li>
<li data-start="789" data-end="830">
<p data-start="791" data-end="830">Real-time face recognition via webcam</p>
</li>
<li data-start="831" data-end="873">
<p data-start="833" data-end="873">Simple, modular, and beginner-friendly</p>
</li>
</ul>

<ul data-start="2795" data-end="2905">
<li data-start="2795" data-end="2851">
<p data-start="2797" data-end="2851">Detects and recognizes known faces from webcam input</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2852" data-end="2905">
<p data-start="2854" data-end="2905">Shows <strong data-start="2860" data-end="2878">User ID / Name</strong> and <strong data-start="2883" data-end="2903">confidence score</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2907" data-end="2910">
<h2 data-start="2912" data-end="2930">Sample Output</h2>
<ul data-start="2931" data-end="3055">
<li data-start="2931" data-end="2985">
<p data-start="2933" data-end="2985">Faces detected are highlighted with <strong data-start="2969" data-end="2983">rectangles</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2986" data-end="3055">
<p data-start="2988" data-end="3055">Recognized faces show <strong data-start="3010" data-end="3028">User ID / Name</strong> and <strong data-start="3033" data-end="3053">confidence score</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="3057" data-end="3060">

<p data-start="3155" data-end="3204">Support <strong data-start="3163" data-end="3202">multi-face recognition and tracking</strong></p>

<ul data-start="1590" data-end="1700">
<li data-start="1590" data-end="1646">
<p data-start="1592" data-end="1646">Detects and recognizes known faces from webcam input</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1647" data-end="1700">
<p data-start="1649" data-end="1700">Shows <strong data-start="1655" data-end="1673">User ID / Name</strong> and <strong data-start="1678" data-end="1698">confidence score</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1702" data-end="1705">
<h3 data-start="1707" data-end="1739"><strong data-start="1711" data-end="1737">Notes for GitHub Users</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1741" data-end="2074">
<li data-start="1741" data-end="1829">
<p data-start="1743" data-end="1829">The <strong data-start="1747" data-end="1777">dataset folder is excluded</strong> from this repository to keep the repo size small.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1830" data-end="1951">
<p data-start="1832" data-end="1951">Users should <strong data-start="1845" data-end="1873">create their own dataset</strong> using <code data-start="1880" data-end="1901">0_create_dataset.py</code> or <strong data-start="1905" data-end="1927">download a dataset</strong> from the shared link.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1952" data-end="2074">
<p data-start="1954" data-end="2074">The <code data-start="1958" data-end="1970">.gitignore</code> file ensures that temporary files, <code data-start="2006" data-end="2019">__pycache__</code>, and large files like datasets are <strong data-start="2055" data-end="2071">not uploaded</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2076" data-end="2079">

<ul data-start="1586" data-end="1690">
<li data-start="1586" data-end="1636">
<p data-start="1588" data-end="1636">Detects and recognizes faces from webcam input</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1637" data-end="1690">
<p data-start="1639" data-end="1690">Shows <strong data-start="1645" data-end="1663">User ID / Name</strong> and <strong data-start="1668" data-end="1688">confidence score</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1692" data-end="1695">
<h3 data-start="1697" data-end="1729"><strong data-start="1701" data-end="1727">Notes for GitHub Users</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1730" data-end="1941">
<li data-start="1730" data-end="1829">
<p data-start="1732" data-end="1829">The <code data-start="1736" data-end="1746">dataset/</code> folder is <strong data-start="1757" data-end="1766">empty</strong> to begin with. Users must <strong data-start="1793" data-end="1826">collect their own face images</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1830" data-end="1941">
<p data-start="1832" data-end="1941">The <code data-start="1836" data-end="1848">.gitignore</code> file ensures temporary files, <code data-start="1879" data-end="1892">__pycache__</code>, and other unnecessary files are not uploaded.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1943" data-end="1946">
<p data-start="1948" data-end="2070">âœ… With this, your GitHub repository will work fine even without a dataset, and users will know exactly how to create it.</p>
<p data-start="2072" data-end="2269">If you want, I can <strong data-start="2091" data-end="2148">now give you a fully polished, ready-to-upload README</strong> combining <strong data-start="2159" data-end="2227">Overview, Features, Workflow, Usage, Future Improvements, Author</strong> with this dataset explanation included.</p>

<blockquote data-start="495" data-end="600">
<p data-start="497" data-end="600">The <code data-start="501" data-end="512">README.md</code> must be at the <strong data-start="528" data-end="570">same level as <code data-start="544" data-end="556">.gitignore</code> and scripts</strong>, not inside another folder.</p>
</blockquote>
<hr data-start="602" data-end="605">
<h2 data-start="607" data-end="656"><strong data-start="610" data-end="654">2. Make sure the file is named correctly</strong></h2>
<ul data-start="657" data-end="769">
<li data-start="657" data-end="699">
<p data-start="659" data-end="699">File name must be exactly: <code data-start="686" data-end="697">README.md</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="700" data-end="769">
<p data-start="702" data-end="769"><strong data-start="702" data-end="720">Case-sensitive</strong>: <code data-start="722" data-end="733">README.md</code> (not <code data-start="739" data-end="750">readme.md</code> or <code data-start="754" data-end="766">ReadMe.txt</code>)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="771" data-end="774">
<h2 data-start="776" data-end="812"><strong data-start="779" data-end="810">3. Commit and push the file</strong></h2>
<p data-start="813" data-end="850">If youâ€™re uploading via GitHub web:</p>
<ul data-start="851" data-end="981">

</li>
<li data-start="913" data-end="981">
<p data-start="915" data-end="981">Scroll down, add a commit message, then click <strong data-start="961" data-end="979">Commit changes</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="1043" data-end="1154"><strong data-start="1043" data-end="1052">Note:</strong> If a README.md already exists, GitHub will ask if you want to <strong data-start="1115" data-end="1129">replace it</strong>. Confirm to overwrite.</p>

<hr data-start="1156" data-end="1159">
<p data-start="1161" data-end="1294">Since your dataset is empty, make sure your README clearly tells users to <strong data-start="1235" data-end="1263">create their own dataset</strong> using <code data-start="1270" data-end="1291">0_create_dataset.py</code>.</p>
<p data-start="1296" data-end="1427">If you want, I can <strong data-start="1315" data-end="1360">give you the final ready-to-upload README</strong> that includes all these instructions and is polished for GitHub.</p>

<hr data-start="360" data-end="363">
<h3 data-start="365" data-end="417"><strong data-start="369" data-end="417">Step-by-step to edit README.md on GitHub Web</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="419" data-end="938">

<li data-start="533" data-end="643">
<p data-start="536" data-end="588">In the <strong data-start="543" data-end="556">file list</strong>, click on <code data-start="567" data-end="578">README.md</code> itself.</p>
<ul data-start="592" data-end="643">
<li data-start="592" data-end="643">
<p data-start="594" data-end="643">Make sure you <strong data-start="608" data-end="626">click the file</strong>, not the folder.</p>

<li data-start="645" data-end="864">
<p data-start="648" data-end="757">At the top-right of the README file view, you should see the <strong data-start="709" data-end="754">pencil icon (âœï¸) labeled â€œEdit this fileâ€</strong>.</p>

<ul data-start="274" data-end="402">
<li data-start="274" data-end="402">
<p data-start="276" data-end="402">You must click <strong data-start="291" data-end="332">on the file name (<code data-start="311" data-end="322">README.md</code>) itself</strong> to open it. The trash icon only appears when a single file is open.</p>

<li data-start="404" data-end="564">

<ul data-start="480" data-end="564">
<li data-start="480" data-end="564">

</li>

The <strong data-start="13" data-end="48">README file should not be a PDF</strong>.</p>
<h3 data-start="53" data-end="63">Why:</h3>
<ul data-start="64" data-end="310">
<li data-start="64" data-end="159">
<p data-start="66" data-end="159">GitHub automatically <strong data-start="87" data-end="121">renders Markdown (<code data-start="107" data-end="112">.md</code>) files</strong> as the repository homepage content.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="160" data-end="310">
<p data-start="162" data-end="184">If you upload a PDF:</p>
<ul data-start="187" data-end="310">
<li data-start="187" data-end="235">
<p data-start="189" data-end="235">GitHub will treat it as a downloadable file.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="238" data-end="310">
<p data-start="240" data-end="310">It will <strong data-start="248" data-end="275">not display the content</strong> directly on the repository page.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 data-start="312" data-end="339">âœ… What you should do:</h3>
<ul data-start="340" data-end="617">
<li data-start="340" data-end="414">
<p data-start="342" data-end="414">Use a <strong data-start="348" data-end="392">plain text file with the extension <code data-start="385" data-end="390">.md</code></strong>, e.g., <code data-start="400" data-end="411">README.md</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="415" data-end="521">
<p data-start="417" data-end="521">Write your content in <strong data-start="439" data-end="458">Markdown format</strong> (you can include headings, lists, code blocks, links, etc.).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="522" data-end="617">
<p data-start="524" data-end="617">When uploaded, GitHub will <strong data-start="551" data-end="578">automatically render it</strong> at the bottom of your repo homepage.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<blockquote data-start="619" data-end="728">
<p data-start="621" data-end="728">You can keep a PDF version separately if you want, but the main README on GitHub <strong data-start="702" data-end="725">must be <code data-start="712" data-end="723">README.md</code></strong>.</p>
</blockquote>
<p data-start="730" data-end="883">If you want, I can <strong data-start="749" data-end="822">create a fully polished <code data-start="775" data-end="786">README.md</code> for your Face Recognition project</strong>, ready to copy-paste into GitHub so it displays perfectly.</p>

rounded-[18px] px-4 py-1.5 data-[multiline]:py-3" data-multiline=""><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">give my readme as github version i will paste my readme here FACE RECOGNITION PROJECT 
Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV 
Overview 
This project implements a real-time face recognition system using Python and OpenCV. It uses Haar Cascade Classifier 
for face detection and LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer for training and recognition. The 
system can detect faces from webcam input, collect datasets, train a model, and perform recognition in real-time. 
Features 
âž¢ Capture dataset of face images using webcam   
âž¢ Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset   
âž¢ Real-time face recognition via webcam   
âž¢ Modular, simple, and beginner-friendly   
Algorithms &amp; Technologies Used 
&gt; Haar Cascade Classifier â†’ For detecting faces in frames   
&gt; LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) â†’ For recognizing and matching faces   
&gt; Python Libraries: 
o OpenCV 
o NumPy 
o Pillow  
Workflow 
1. Create Dataset â€“ Capture 30 samples of the userâ€™s face via webcam   
2. Train Model â€“ Train LBPH recognizer using the collected dataset   
3.  Recognize Faces â€“ Detect and recognize faces in real-time

Installation 
1. Clone this repository: 
git clone https://github.com/YourUsername/FaceRecognitionProject.git 
cd FaceRecognitionProject 
2. Install required dependencies: 
pip install -r requirements.txt 
Usage 
1. Collect Dataset 
python 0_create_dataset.py 
â–ª Enter a numeric user ID and name 
â–ª Look at the camera until 30 samples are captured in the dataset/ folder 
2. Train Model 
python 1_train_model.py 
â€¢ Trains LBPH model and generates trainer.yml 
3. Run Real-Time Recognition 
python 2_face_recognition.py 
â€¢ Detects and recognizes known faces from webcam input 
â€¢ Shows User ID / Name and confidence score 
Sample Output 
â€¢ Faces detected are highlighted with rectangles 
â€¢ Recognized faces show User ID / Name and confidence score 
Notes for GitHub Users 
â€¢ The dataset/ folder is empty to begin with. Users must collect their own face images. 
â€¢ The .gitignore file ensures temporary files, __pycache__, and other unnecessary files are not uploaded. 
Future Improvements 
â€¢ Add deep learning-based recognition (FaceNet, Dlib) 
â€¢ Multi-face recognition and tracking 
â€¢ GUI for easier use 
â€¢ Database integration for storing face data

class="whitespace-pre! language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># FACE RECOGNITION PROJECT</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV**</span></span><span>

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Overview</span></span><span>
This project implements a </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**real-time face recognition system**</span></span><span> using Python and OpenCV. It uses </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Haar Cascade Classifier**</span></span><span> for face detection and </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer**</span></span><span> for training and recognition. The system can detect faces from webcam input, collect datasets, train a model, and perform recognition in real-time.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Features</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Capture dataset of face images using webcam  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Real-time face recognition via webcam  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Modular, simple, and beginner-friendly  

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Algorithms &amp; Technologies Used</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Haar Cascade Classifier**</span></span><span> â†’ For detecting faces in frames  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms)**</span></span><span> â†’ For recognizing and matching faces  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Python Libraries:**</span></span><span>  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> OpenCV  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> NumPy  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">  -</span></span><span> Pillow  

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Workflow</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">1.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Create Dataset**</span></span><span> â€“ Capture 30 samples of the userâ€™s face via webcam  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">2.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Train Model**</span></span><span> â€“ Train LBPH recognizer using the collected dataset  
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">3.</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-strong">**Recognize Faces**</span></span><span> â€“ Detect and recognize faces in real-time  

---

aria-live="polite"></div><div tabindex="-1" class="cm-scroller"><div spellcheck="false" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" translate="no" contenteditable="false" style="tab-size: 4; flex-basis: 1016px;" class="cm-content" role="textbox" aria-multiline="true" aria-readonly="true"><div class="cm-line"># FACE RECOGNITION PROJECT</div><div class="cm-line">Real-Time Face Detection &amp; Recognition using OpenCV</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Overview</div><div class="cm-line">This project implements a real-time face recognition system using Python and OpenCV. It uses Haar Cascade Classifier for face detection and LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) Face Recognizer for training and recognition. The system can detect faces from webcam input, collect datasets, train a model, and perform recognition in real-time.</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Features</div><div class="cm-line">- Capture dataset of face images using webcam</div><div class="cm-line">- Train an LBPH model on the collected dataset</div><div class="cm-line">- Real-time face recognition via webcam</div><div class="cm-line">- Modular, simple, and beginner-friendly</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Algorithms &amp; Technologies Used</div><div class="cm-line">- Haar Cascade Classifier -&gt; For detecting faces in frames</div><div class="cm-line">- LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms) -&gt; For recognizing and matching faces</div><div class="cm-line">- Python Libraries:</div><div class="cm-line">  - OpenCV</div><div class="cm-line">  - NumPy</div><div class="cm-line">  - Pillow</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Workflow</div><div class="cm-line">1. Create Dataset â€“ Capture 30 samples of the userâ€™s face via webcam</div><div class="cm-line">2. Train Model â€“ Train LBPH recognizer using the collected dataset</div><div class="cm-line">3. Recognize Faces â€“ Detect and recognize faces in real-time</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Project Structure</div><div class="cm-line">FaceRecognitionProject/</div><div class="cm-line">- dataset/                                # Folder to store captured face images (currently empty)</div><div class="cm-line">- .gitignore</div><div class="cm-line">- 0_create_dataset.py          # Script to collect face dataset using webcam</div><div class="cm-line">- 1_train_model.py             # Script to train the recognizer and save trainer.yml</div><div class="cm-line">- 2_face_recognition.py        # Real-time face recognition script</div><div class="cm-line">- 3_haarcascade_frontalface_default.xml</div><div class="cm-line">- 4_trainer.yml                 # Trained model file (generated after training)</div><div class="cm-line">- 5_requirements.txt            # Dependencies</div><div class="cm-line">- README.md</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Note: The dataset/ folder is empty and is not uploaded to GitHub. Users need to create their own dataset using the provided script.</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Installation</div><div class="cm-line">1. Clone this repository:</div><div class="cm-line">git clone https://github.com/YourUsername/FaceRecognitionProject.git</div><div class="cm-line">cd FaceRecognitionProject</div><div class="cm-line">2. Install required dependencies:</div><div class="cm-line">pip install -r requirements.txt</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">Usage</div><div class="cm-line">1. Collect Dataset</div><div class="cm-line">python 0_create_dataset.py</div><div class="cm-line">- Enter a numeric user ID and name</div><div class="cm-line">- Look at the camera until 30 samples are captured in the dataset/ folder</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">2. Train Model</div><div class="cm-line">python 1_train_model.py</div><div class="cm-line">- Trains LBPH model and generates trainer.yml</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line">3. Run Real-Time Recognition</div><div class="cm-line">python 2_face_recognition.py</div><div class="cm-gap" style="height: 411.469px;"></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></section></section></div></div></div></div><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="e5fed300-0831-4956-976f-ece755fc4259" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-5-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light markdown-new-styling"><p data-start="0" data-end="200">Iâ€™ve created a plain text version of your README in a file named <strong data-start="65" data-end="98"><code data-start="67" data-end="96">face_recognition_readme.txt</code></strong>.
